column4: I have some trouble with graphics on Jaunty: 1. full-screen windows flicker badly when tooltips are shown  2. 3D graphics in Mathematica only appear when they are being rotated, but not otherwise. This is not fixed by turning off desktop effects.

On some forums it was suggested to turn on "uxa" acceleration, which semi-fixes Mathematica, but then X freezes from time to time (every 2-3 hours).  Do you have any suggestions about fixing these problems?
di you try EXA it is much better than UXA
EXA is the default, but Mathematica 3D graphics don't work with it.  I can't use UXA because the system freezes hard from time to time.
The full-screen window flicker is present both with exa and uxa
am guessing you have a intel graphics card?
